oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-09-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 14, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performer George Jones, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Rod Brasfield, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 936th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rod Brasfield; George Jones; Stringbean; Ernest Tubb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) [continued from part 1] -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ernest Tubb introduces George Jones -- Hearts In My Dream (George Jones) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Stringbean -- Cripple Creek (Stringbean) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- My Treasure (Ernest Tubb) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements -- Noel Hotel commercial (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Old Hickory Singers; Jackson, Tommy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Byrd, Billy; Jones, George, 1931-2013
